# Betty Trask Prize and Awards

The Betty Trask Prize and Awards are for first novels written by authors under the age of 35 who reside in a current or former Commonwealth nation. Each year the awards total at least , with normally one author receiving a larger prize amount ( in very recent years), called the "Prize", and the remainder given to the other nominees, called the "Awards". These were established in 1984 by the Society of Authors at the bequest of the late Betty Trask, a reclusive author of over thirty romance novels.[http://facstaff.unca.edu/moseley/trask.html Betty Trask Prize and Awards]  They're given to traditional or romantic novels, rather than those of an experimental style, and either published or unpublished works.
